comment.author: 11953092@N04
comment._content: The only A Dodgson I can find for the ASC is A D Dodgson [Arthur Douglas Dodgson]. He was promoted to Captain and was awarded the OBE. The LG confirms this: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/32377/supplements/5308 and looks to have survived the war. I can't find his OBE entry in the LG sadly. His MIC states his service was for the EEF (Egyptian Expedition Force), a reminder that France/Flanders wasn't the only place where the British Army fought in WWI.

comment.author: 69788210@N08
comment._content: That's really interesting. I wonder if it is the same Dodgson? This is a favourite image from this collection - they both look so solemn. I wonder if anyone else out there can help identify this man or his daughter?

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
The MIC indicates his entry into the EEF operational theatre was in Dec 1915 - and the qualifying dates for his war service then going right through to Nov 1918.

A very long shot:  There is an Arthur Douglas Dodgson recorded born in Bromley Parish in 1884.  Also an Arthur D Dodgson married Juliet Capron in Marylebone, Jun 1912.  Too easy to make these names neatly fit this Arthur Douglas Dodgson RASC though, without corroborative evidence.//

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Temporary Captain Arthur Douglas Dodgson's OBE is published in the Supplement to the London Gazette of 3 June 1919, page 6923.

There is also a London Gazette notice (17 May 1927 page 3237) for an Arthur Douglas Dodgson; dissolving a stockbroking partnership between george Palmer HOPE; William Henley DODGSON; George Meredith HOPE; and Arthur Douglas DODGSON; formerly Hope, Dodgson & Co, dated 12 May 1927.//

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Possibly:  This Arthur Douglas Dodgson was the son of William Henley Dodgson, (b. c1851), and Harriet Lambarde, who he married in 1879.  There were 6 children; Arthur Douglas; Raymond Charles; Richard Heathfield; Cicely Charlotte; John Henley; and William Lambarde.  [2Lt John Henley Dodgson of the Queen's Own (Royal West Kents) was killed in action on 7 Jun 1917].

This Arthur Douglas Dodgson died 27 May 1959 at The Hospital, Cuckfield, Sussex.  His wife, Juliet Henrietta (Capron?), pre-deceased him on 15 Jul 1951 at 'Shrapnells', Byfleet, Surrey.

The little girl might therefore be their only daughter, Ione Juliet Dodgson.//

All detail obtained from the research of 'One Guy from Barlick' - 'Dodgson Descendants' website.//

comment.author: 69782596@N07
comment._content:
Further likely info on Arthur and daughter Ione….   (all information from Ancestry.co.uk):

1884 born in Bromley, Kent.

1901 census - at school in Winchester, aged 16.

1911 census - staying with his uncle (Henley Frederick Dodgson) in Hemel Hempstead.  Occupation - 'Stock Exchange'.

1912 (April 18) married Juliet Henrietta Capron in Marylebone.  Father given as William Henley Dodgson, Stockbroker.

1913 (quarter 2) daughter's birth registered Ione J. Dodgson (mother's maiden name Capron)

1956 ship's passengers:
 - Arthur Dodgson, d.o.b. 12 August 1884, occupation Stockbroker
 - Ione Dodgson, d.o.b. 2 May 1913, occupation Secretary
 (addresses both 155 Sloane Street, London) 

1959 Arthur died in Cuckfield, Sussex.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: There is no longer any knowledge of the Dodgson family at 155 Sloane Street (SW1X 9AB). I called there yesterday - a lovely big house on several storeys, now extremely smart apartment flats with an entrance off Wilbraham Place. An Ione Juliet Dodgson is listed in London on the .192 Directory; and also in the Company House index of CEO at SW3 4TB - Which strangely enough is in the vicinity of Sloane Street - approx 30-40 Sloane Court. Of course, she would be 99 years old now!//  Went to 36 Sloane Court on way back from National Army Museum - the caretaker there remembers Ione, who went into a care home from there in about 2006.//

comment.author: 32300107@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/osmianannya] Thank you for finding these interesting details.

comment.author: 106613212@N02
comment._content:
The family of Arthur and Ione Dodgson can confirm that is a photo of them both, taken in about 1915/6.
After the war which Arthur survived, he continued to work at the family firm of Hope Dodgson at the Royal Exchange in the City of London.  This was quite a family affair, but eventually merged with other companies in the 1970's.
Ione died on July 18th 2013, aged 100, and was pleased to  receive her 100th telegram from the Queen.  She moved from her Sloane Street apartment in November 2004 and lived for most of those last 9 years at Meadbank Nursing Home, Battersea.
The details you have for Arthur and Ione are correct.  Ione spent WW2 as a market gardener at her parent's home of Shrapnells in Byfleet - just on the edge of the Brooklands racing track, although the family think this may have been a cover for more secret war work.  Qualified as a Latin American dance instructor she danced beautifully, often with her father whom she accompanied on trips to Brazil after the war. Ione never married.
